data.title: Distribute units in area
data.body:
It would be really useful to have a "distribute units across area" command.

I imagine it working much like the mine layer in that a rectangular area can be chosen. This would be a one-off thing, though, unlike the mine layer, and any selected units move to points spread out across the selected area. It'd be great for sending rocket troops to defend an ore field from helicopters, for example, rather than having to move them out one at a time or repeatedly hit X until they're sufficiently far apart. It'd also be useful for telling a bunch of artillery to arrange themselves into a line (a 1-by-X rectangle), spacing themselves out defensively.

A basic implementation would choose tiles in the area at random for each selected unit; a better one would choose randomly out of only viable tiles (no water for ground units, for example); better again would look at the space selected and the number of units and distribute them evenly. Better still, the target points would be assigned in some sane way, for example making the expected transit times for each unit as even as possible.

Thinking about it even more, the abilities of the selected units could be examined and target destinations chosen to distribute _those_. For example, strong vs air, strong vs armour and strong vs infantry units distributed somewhat evenly. Of course, that could be done fairly easily by the user in a multi step process too, by selecting all rocket soldiers at once and distributing them, then doing the same for riflemen and so on.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1434766-distribute-units-in-area?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Renamed Flak Truck to Mobile Flak
data.body:
Needed to remake this PR.

Renamed Flak Truck to Mobile Flak, also updated the unit to use a new icon provided by @KatzSmile, located here: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&p=286374#286374. Matches the unit in game more closely as well.

Comparison of old (left) + new (right):
![flakicon2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/566742/2354402/f14146d8-a5be-11e3-8790-07c483e26ec3.png)

data.title: TD cnc music gone
data.body: Ok, i've got a weird problem with the music on TD. Originally there was no music, but then i downloaded the disc iso for GDI and went back, the mod extracted the music just fine. Then I decided to try and add the extra unused songs available from C&C v1.06c by adding the scores mix file directly (a suggestion on the forums of cncc-comm when i was looking for the music) and it worked, but got rid of all the original music! I decided I'd rather have the first set, so i deleted the scores.mix file and opened it again, but now all the music is gone except the menu music and mission complete music. I tried extracting from the cd again, but there's an error every time. Even tried extracting from the Nod iso, same problem. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling, same thing. If anyone could help I would greatly appreciate it. Thanks! So far though the whole thing is playing really well!

data.title: Add team attributes to map actor "player spawn"
data.body:
While creating maps, there should be a way to assign possible teams to spawning points. A player spawn could have team 1 for a 2 team game, team 2 for 3 team game etc. There could also be variations for different team combinations like west vs east or north vs south.

![spawn_teams](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6599106/2369698/0f9eae0e-a7e5-11e3-9678-6d3a882bd176.png)

This would make it possible to implement a feature that allows the game admin to automatically assign teams and corresponding spawning points to all the players in game lobby and eliminate the frustrating and time consuming process of making sure every player has chosen the correct team and spawning point.

data.title: Building charge improvements
data.body:
Improves AttackTesla and renames it to AttackCharge.
Improvement mostly consists of un-hardcoding two delays which should make this suitable for Obelisk-type defenses as well.
This naming should also make it more clear that [currently] only this attack type supports charging.

Furthermore, changes RenderBuildingCharge default for ChargeAudio to null because I dislike those hidden defaults.
Also added ChargeSequence so the sequence name is no longer hardcoded to be "active".

Supercedes #4703.

data.title: Show player name before support power timers
data.body:
Countdown timers for atom bomb and satellite launch that are shown at the top left of the screen are in players' colors to indicate to whom they belong. But this is not always helpful. Often times players have very similar colors, the same color may be chosen by players on different teams and it is hard to distinguish which timer belongs to which player. Instead of colors, player names should be used to show countdown timers. Timers for allies could be shown in green and those for enemies in red. Or player colors and names both could be shown. Also I don't know if this is already done but timers for allies and enemies should be grouped so for example those for allies are on top and the ones for enemies below them...

Of course multiple players may also have the same name but this is less of an issue and it also encourages players to change the default name "Newbie" to something else.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1434010-show-player-name-in-atom-bomb-countdown-timer?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Fix chat synchronization in replays.
Craters should be removed when placing a building or deploying an MCV on top of it.
data.body:
Right now, after the building is sold, or the MCV unpacked, the crater is still there.

This would let players undo the damage they did to the map.

data.title: TD, Loading Near Dead (or actually dead?) Infantry Into an APC Crashes The Game
data.body:
I had an APC with infantry in it.

I unloaded the APC on Tiberium (because I am a bad man).

I loaded the infantry back at very close to 0 health, the animation actually showed them dying, but the little green sqaures on the APC's UI showed that I had loaded the infantry back in.

I deploy the APC again to unload the infantry. Game crashed the instant I gave the deploy command.

I don't know if the chinook loading infantry has the same problem, I will check later. (Update: doing the same with the chinook also crashes the game)

I don't know if loading infantry nearly killed by gunfire will cause the same problem, or is it only the  Tiberium. I will check later (Update: confirmed. I loaded infantry killed by gunfire into a Chinook, and the game crashed when I unloaded the Chinook)

Here is the replay, please start paying attention to the APC at 03:50.
https://app.box.com/s/gesapsdc5s4gpnvipv1c

Here is the the exceptions log:

Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5477
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (e1 148 (not in world))
    OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor)
    OpenRA.TraitDictionary.Get[T](Actor actor)
    OpenRA.Actor.Trait[T]()
    OpenRA.Mods.RA.Activities.UnloadCargo.ChooseExitTile(Actor self, Actor cargo)
    OpenRA.Mods.RA.Activities.UnloadCargo.Tick(Actor self)
    OpenRA.Traits.Util.RunActivity(Actor self, Activity act)
    OpenRA.World.Tick()
    OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
    OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
    OpenRA.Game.Run()
    OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
    OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Display a marker on map when being attacked
data.body: If you play big map, have lots of allies with different colors and your buildings/units all scattered all over the map, then the alerts of being attacked are almost useless. It would be very nice if some kind of marker would appear to the map, for example buildings/units flashing red/white. Even better if you could also see attacks to your allies.
